alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:24PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cherry, eastern Hooker, northwestern Logan, northeastern McPherson and western Thomas Counties through 615 PM CDT/515 PM MDT/... At 524 PM CDT/424 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 24 miles south of Merriman to 14 miles south of Medicine Lake to 23 miles northeast of Whitman to 7 miles southwest of Mullen. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Seneca, Medicine Lake, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Speckel Meir Lake, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Steer Creek Campground, Schoolhouse Lake, Marsh Flat, Norway, Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River, Indian Hill, Giant Hill, Highway 97 crossing Big Creek, Sevenmile Hill, Hecla and Kelso. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 174 and 209. Highway 61 between mile markers 196 and 206. Highway 97 between mile markers 49 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT/800 PM MDT/ for north central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
